docs.lead_paragraph: HENLEY-ON-THAMES, England, July 3 (AP)--John B. Kelly Jr. 19-year-old United States Navy enlisted man, won his first heat, to day in a bid for a Henley regatt title which was denied his Olympi champion father in 1920 by a barrier against entries who had don manual labor.

headline.main: KELLY WINS HEAT IN HENLEV REGATTA; Son of U.S. Man Barred in '20 Rows to Victory as His Father Watches

docs.snippet: President Peron's three-hour parade of military might in Buenos Aires may have had several motivations. There can be little doubt that its primary purpose was to impress Argentina's neighbors.

docs.snippet: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y., July 13 --A five-man delegation from the Headquarters Commission of the United Nations held a special, closed conference here today with Westchester officials concerning a permanent world headquarters site, and in the conference...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y., July 13 --A five-man delegation from the Headquarters Commission of the United Nations held a special, closed conference here today with Westchester officials concerning a permanent world headquarters site, and in the conference established a general site-investigation program that, in the words of one Westchester official, left "everybody pleased and happy."
